diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Iodotyrosine Deiodinase Defect related to Congenital Hypothyroidism
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was established based on the identification of a homozygous mutation in the iodotyrosine deiodinase gene (IYD) in the index patient who presented with severe hypothyroidism and a multinodular goiter. Urinary measurements of monoiodotyrosine (MIT) and diiodotyrosine (DIT) supported the defect, and the presence of the same mutation in a sibling indicated familial transmission.
